title: How to Make Celery Cheese Sticks

steps.headline: Prepare the celery.
steps.description: Thoroughly wash the stalks to eliminate any dirt. Cut each stalk into 4" lengths. Depending on the length of the stalk, you might get 2-4 pieces out of it.

steps.headline: Divide the cream cheese into different bowls.
steps.description: The number of bowls will determine on how many different colors you want. Decide on whether you want to do rainbow colors, holiday themed colors, or just one color for everything. For a fun twist on this snack, add a drop or two of food coloring of each bowl. If you want a darker color, add an additional drop. Mix the colors and cream cheese together thoroughly.

steps.headline: Add each desired color to a plastic zipped bag.
steps.description: Snip a small corner from the bottom of the bag.

steps.headline: Use the bag(s) to squeeze the cream cheese on the celery.
steps.description: You can "free-squirt" or use a decorative cake tip for more accuracy. Squirt the cream cheese into the "cove" of each celery stalk, from top to bottom.

steps.headline: Serve the finished celery stalks on a platter.

text: Prepare the celery. Thoroughly wash the stalks to eliminate any dirt. Cut each stalk into 4" lengths. Depending on the length of the stalk, you might get 2-4 pieces out of it. Divide the cream cheese into different bowls. The number of bowls will determine on how many different colors you want. Decide on whether you want to do rainbow colors, holiday themed colors, or just one color for everything. For a fun twist on this snack, add a drop or two of food coloring of each bowl. If you want a darker color, add an additional drop. Mix the colors and cream cheese together thoroughly. Add each desired color to a plastic zipped bag. Snip a small corner from the bottom of the bag. Use the bag(s) to squeeze the cream cheese on the celery. You can "free-squirt" or use a decorative cake tip for more accuracy. Squirt the cream cheese into the "cove" of each celery stalk, from top to bottom. Serve the finished celery stalks on a platter.
